1:
Woe to the rebellious city! The violent city is defiled.
\q
2:
She has not listened to the voice of God, nor accepted correction from Yahweh.
\q She does not trust in Yahweh and will not approach her God.
3:
Her princes are roaring lions in her midst.
\q Her judges are evening wolves who leave nothing to be gnawed upon in the morning.
\q
4:
Her prophets are insolent and treasonous men.
\q Her priests have profaned what is holy and have done violence to the law.
5:
Yahweh is righteous in her midst. He can do no wrong.
\q2 Morning by morning he will dispense his justice! It will not be hidden in the light, yet unrighteous people know no shame.
6:
"I have destroyed nations; their fortresses are ruined.
\q I have made their streets ruins, so that no one passes over them.
\q Their cities are destroyed so that there is no man inhabiting them.
\q
7:
I said, 'Surely you will fear me. Accept correction
\q and do not be cut off from your homes by all that I have planned to do to you.'
\q But they were eager to begin each morning by corrupting all their deeds.
8:
Therefore wait for me—this is Yahweh's declaration—until the day that I rise up for the victim.
\q For my decision is to gather the nations, to assemble the kingdoms,
\q and to pour out upon them my anger, all my fierce wrath,
\q so that all the land will be devoured by the fire of my anger.
\f + \ft The Hebrew text as \fqa until the day that I rise up for the victim \fqa* . However, some ancient and modern versions have \fqa until the day that I rise up as a witness \fqa* . \f*
9:
But then I will give pure lips to the people,
\q to call all of them in the name of Yahweh to serve me standing shoulder to shoulder.
\q
10:
From beyond the river of Ethiopia my worshipers—my scattered people—will bring offerings due me.
\q
11:
In that day you will not be put to shame for all your deeds that you committed against me,
\q since at that time I will remove from among you those who celebrated your pride,
\q and because you will no longer act arrogantly on my holy mountain.
12:
But I will leave you as a lowly and poor people,
\q and you will take refuge in the name of Yahweh.
\q
14:
Sing, daughter of Zion! Shout, Israel.
\q Be glad and rejoice with all your heart, daughter of Jerusalem.
\q
15:
Yahweh has taken away your punishment; he has driven out your enemies!
\q Yahweh is the king of Israel among you. You will never again fear evil!
\q
16:
In that day they will say to Jerusalem,
\q "Do not fear, Zion. Do not let your hands falter.
17:
Yahweh your God is among you, a mighty one to save you.
\q He will celebrate over you and with joy he will be silent over you in his love.
\q He will be glad over you and he will shout for joy,
\q
18:
as on the day of the appointed feasts.
\q I will take away disaster from you;
\q you will no longer bear any shame for it.
\f + \ft This verse is very difficult to understand, and modern versions translate it in many different ways. \f*
19:
Behold, I am about to deal with all your oppressors.
\q At that time, I will rescue the lame and gather up the outcast.
\q I will make them as praise, and I will change their shame into renown in all the earth.
\q
20:
At that time I will lead you; at that time I will gather you together.
\q I will make all the nations of the earth respect and praise you, when you see that I restored you,"
\q says Yahweh.
